description: Σ contracts first, producing a smaller tensor; Θ then assigns or updates polarity channels on the result.

effect.polarity\_behavior: Θ labels the contracted result; polarity assignment may hide channel-wise cancellation details.

commutativity: Non-commutative: Θ ∘ Σ generally does not preserve the ΣΘ channel-wise structure of ΣΘ ∘ Θ.
